00036 /******************************************************************************//**
00037   * Base class for the object of PTEID SDK (Can not be instantiated).
00038   *********************************************************************************/
00039 class PTEID_Object
00040 {
00041 public:
00042         PTEIDSDK_API virtual ~PTEID_Object()=0;         /**< Destructor */
00043 
00044 
00045         NOEXPORT_PTEIDSDK void Init(const SDK_Context *context,void *impl);     /**< For internal use : Initialize pimpl */
00046 
00047         /**
00048           * Release the objects instantiated within this PTEID_Object.
00049           * Automatically call in the destructor.
00050           */
00051         NOEXPORT_PTEIDSDK void Release();
00052 
00053 protected:
00054         PTEID_Object(const SDK_Context *context,void *impl);    /**< For internal use : Constructor */
00055         void addObject(PTEID_Object *impl);                     /**< For internal use : Add linked object */
00056         void backupObject(unsigned long idx);           /**< For internal use : Backup linked object */
00057         PTEID_Object *getObject(unsigned long idx);     /**< For internal use : Return an object by its index */
00058         PTEID_Object *getObject(void *impl);                    /**< For internal use : Return an object by its impl */
00059         void delObject(unsigned long idx);                      /**< For internal use : Delete an object by its index */
00060         void delObject(void *impl);                                     /**< For internal use : Delete an object by its impl */
00061 
00062         void checkContextStillOk() const;                       /**< For internal use : check if the Context is still correct (the card hasn't changed) */
00063 
00064         PTEID_Object(const PTEID_Object& obj);                          /**< Copy not allowed - not implemented */
00065         PTEID_Object& operator= (const PTEID_Object& obj);      /**< Copy not allowed - not implemented */
00066 
00067         bool m_delimpl;                                                 /**< For internal use : m_impl object must be deleted */
00068         void *m_impl;                                                   /**< For internal use : pimpl pointer */
00069         unsigned long m_ulIndexExtAdd;                  /**< For internal use : extended add object */
00070         std::map<unsigned long,PTEID_Object *> m_objects;       /**< For internal use : Map of object instantiated within this PTEID_Object */
00071 
00072         SDK_Context *m_context;                                 /**< For internal use : context structure */
00073 
00074         //CMutex *m_mutex;
00075 };

00081 /******************************************************************************//**
00082   * This class is used to receive/pass bytes array from/to different method in the SDK.
00083   *********************************************************************************/
00084 class PTEID_ByteArray : public PTEID_Object
00085 {
00086 public:
00087     PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_ByteArray();                                                             /**< Default constructor */
00088         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_ByteArray(const PTEID_ByteArray &bytearray); /**< Copy constructor */
00089 
00090          /**
00091           * Constructor - initialize a byte array with an array of unsigned char.
00092           *
00093           * @param pucData is the byte array
00094           * @param ulSize is the size of the array
00095           */
00096     PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_ByteArray(const unsigned char * pucData, unsigned long ulSize);
00097 
00098         PTEIDSDK_API virtual ~PTEID_ByteArray();                                /**< Destructor */
00099 
00100          /**
00101           * Append data to the byte array.
00102           *
00103           * @param pucData is the byte array
00104           * @param ulSize is the size of the array
00105           */
00106     PTEIDSDK_API void Append(const unsigned char * pucData, unsigned long ulSize);
00107 
00108          /**
00109           * Append data to the byte array.
00110           */
00111     PTEIDSDK_API void Append(const PTEID_ByteArray &data);
00112 
00113          /**
00114           * Remove the data from the byte array.
00115           */
00116     PTEIDSDK_API void Clear();
00117 
00118          /**
00119           * Return true if the content of data is the same as this.
00120           */
00121     PTEIDSDK_API bool Equals(const PTEID_ByteArray &data) const;
00122 
00123          /**
00124           * Return the number of bytes in the array.
00125           */
00126     PTEIDSDK_API unsigned long Size() const;
00127 
00128         /**
00129           * Return the array of bytes in the object.
00130           * If Size() == 0, then NULL is returned.
00131           */
00132         PTEIDSDK_API const unsigned char *GetBytes() const;
00133 
00134         /**
00135           * Writing the binary content to a file.
00136           */
00137         PTEIDSDK_API bool writeToFile(const char * csFilePath);
00138 
00139         /**
00140           * Copy content of bytearray.
00141           */
00142         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_ByteArray &operator=(const PTEID_ByteArray &bytearray);
00143 
00144         NOEXPORT_PTEIDSDK PTEID_ByteArray(const SDK_Context *context,const CByteArray &impl);   /**< For internal use : construct from lower level object*/
00145         NOEXPORT_PTEIDSDK PTEID_ByteArray &operator=(const CByteArray &bytearray);                      /**< For internal use : copy from lower level object*/
00146 };

00171 /**
00172   * This define give an easy access to singleton (no declaration/instantiation is needed).
00173   *
00174   * Usage : ReaderSet.SomeMethod().
00175   */
00176 #define ReaderSet PTEID_ReaderSet::instance()
00177 
00178 /**
00179   * Init the SDK (Optional).
00180   */
00181 #define PTEID_InitSDK() PTEID_ReaderSet::initSDK()
00182 
00183 /**
00184   * Release the SDK.
00185   * THIS MUST BE CALLED WHEN THE SDK IS NOT NEEDED ANYMORE AND BEFORE THE APPLICATION IS CALLED.
00186   * IF NOT RELEASE PROPERLY, AN EXCEPTION PTEID_ExReleaseNeeded IS THROWN.
00187   */
00188 #define PTEID_ReleaseSDK() PTEID_ReaderSet::releaseSDK()

00190 class PTEID_ReaderContext;
00191 class APL_ReaderContext;
00192 
00193 /******************************************************************************//**
00194   * This is a singleton class that is the starting point to get all other objects.
00195   * You get an instance from the static instance() method (or using the define ReaderSet).
00196   * Then you get a READER                                                       (PTEID_ReaderContext)
00197   *             -> from this reader, you a CARD                         (PTEID_Card or derived class)
00198   *                     -> from this card, you get DOCUMENT             (PTEID_XMLDoc or derived class)
00199   *                             -> ...
00200   *********************************************************************************/
00201 class PTEID_ReaderSet : public PTEID_Object
00202 {
00203 public:
00204     PTEIDSDK_API static PTEID_ReaderSet &instance();            /**< Return the singleton object (create it at first use) */
00205 
00206         /**
00207           * Init the SDK (Optional).
00208           * @param bManageTestCard If true the applayer must ask if test cards are allowed (used for compatibility with old C API).
00209           * @param bManageTestCard If false other applications (ex. gui) take that into their scope
00210           */
00211         PTEIDSDK_API static void initSDK(bool bManageTestCard=false);
00212         PTEIDSDK_API static void releaseSDK();                          /**< Release the SDK */
00213 
00214         PTEIDSDK_API virtual ~PTEID_ReaderSet();                                /**< Destructor */
00215 
00216         /**
00217           * Release the readers (Useful if readers had changed).
00218           *
00219           * @param bAllReference If true all the invalid reference/pointer are destroyed.
00220           * @param bAllReference        PUT THIS PARAMETER TO TRUE IS THREAD UNSAFE.
00221           * @param bAllReference        You have to be sure that you will not use any old reference/pointer after this release
00222           */
00223         PTEIDSDK_API void releaseReaders(bool bAllReference=false);
00224 
00225         /**
00226           * Return true if readers has been added or removed
00227           */
00228         PTEIDSDK_API bool isReadersChanged() const;
00229 
00230         /**
00231           * Get the list of the reader.
00232           * Return an array of const char *
00233           * The last pointer is NULL
00234           * Usage : const char * const *ppList=PTEID_ReaderSet::readerList();
00235           *         for(const char * const *ppName=ppList;*ppName!=NULL;ppName++) {...}
00236           *
00237           * @param bForceRefresh force the reconnection to the lower layer to see if reader list have changed
00238           */
00239     PTEIDSDK_API const char * const *readerList(bool bForceRefresh=false);
00240 
00241         /**
00242           * Return the first readercontext with a card.
00243           *             If no card is present, return the firs reader.
00244           *             If no reader exist, throw an exception PTEID_ExNoReader.
00245           */
00246         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_ReaderContext &getReader();
00247 
00248         /**
00249           * Get the reader by its name.
00250           */
00251         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_ReaderContext &getReaderByName(const char *readerName);
00252 
00253         /**
00254           * Return the number of card readers connected to the computer.
00255           *
00256           * @param bForceRefresh force the reconnection to the lower layer to see if reader list have changed
00257           */
00258     PTEIDSDK_API unsigned long readerCount(bool bForceRefresh=false);
00259 
00260         /**
00261           * Get the name of the reader by its Index.
00262           * Throw PTEID_ExParamRange exception if the index is out of range.
00263           */
00264         PTEIDSDK_API const char *getReaderName(unsigned long ulIndex);
00265 
00266         /**
00267           * Get the reader by its Index.
00268           * Throw PTEID_ExParamRange exception if the index is out of range.
00269           */
00270         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_ReaderContext &getReaderByNum(unsigned long ulIndex);
00271 
00272         /**
00273           * Return the reader containing the card with this SN.
00274           *             If no card with this SN is found, throw an exception PTEID_ExParamRange.
00275           */
00276         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_ReaderContext &getReaderByCardSerialNumber(const char *cardSerialNumber);
00277 
00278         /**
00279         * Flush the cached files.
00280         * Return if any files were flushed (T/F).
00281         */;
00282         PTEIDSDK_API bool flushCache();                 /**< Flush the cache */
00283 
00284         NOEXPORT_PTEIDSDK PTEID_ReaderContext &getReader(APL_ReaderContext *pAplReader); /**< For internal use - Not exported*/
00285 
00286 private:
00287         PTEID_ReaderSet();                                                                                      /**< For internal use : Constructor */
00288 
00289         PTEID_ReaderSet(const PTEID_ReaderSet& reader);                         /**< Copy not allowed - not implemented */
00290         PTEID_ReaderSet& operator= (const PTEID_ReaderSet& reader);     /**< Copy not allowed - not implemented */
00291 
00292 };

00294 class PTEID_Card;
00295 class PTEID_EIDCard;
00296 class PTEID_KidsCard;
00297 class PTEID_ForeignerCard;
00298 class PTEID_SISCard;

00300 /******************************************************************************//**
00301   * This class represent a reader.
00302   * You get reader object from the ReaderSet
00303   *             either by its index (getReaderByNum) or by its name (getReaderByName).
00304   * Once you have a reader object, you can check if a card is present (isCardPresent).
00305   * Then you can ask which type of card is in the reader with getCardType()
00306   *             and then get a card object using one of this method :
00307   *                     getCard, getEIDCard, getKidsCard, getForeignerCard or getSISCard.
00308   *********************************************************************************/
00309 class PTEID_ReaderContext : public PTEID_Object
00310 {
00311 public:
00312         /**
00313           * Construct using a fileType and fileName.
00314           *             No physical reader are connected (m_reader=NULL)
00315           */
00316         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_ReaderContext(PTEID_FileType fileType,const char *fileName);
00317 
00318         /**
00319           * Construct using a fileType and its content (for compatibility with SetRawFile).
00320           *             No physical reader are connected (m_reader=NULL)
00321           */
00322         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_ReaderContext(PTEID_FileType fileType,const PTEID_ByteArray &data);
00323 
00324         /**
00325           * Construct using Raw data for Eid.
00326           *             No physical reader are connected (m_reader=NULL)
00327           */
00328         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_ReaderContext(const PTEID_RawData_Eid &data);
00329 
00330         /**
00331           * Construct using Raw data for Sis.
00332           *             No physical reader are connected (m_reader=NULL)
00333           */
00334         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_ReaderContext(const PTEID_RawData_Sis &data);
00335 
00336         PTEIDSDK_API virtual ~PTEID_ReaderContext();    /**< Destructor */
00337 
00338         /**
00339           * Return the name of the reader.
00340           */
00341         PTEIDSDK_API const char *getName();
00342 
00343         /**
00344           * Return true if a card is present and false otherwise.
00345           */
00346     PTEIDSDK_API bool isCardPresent();
00347 
00348         /**
00349           * Release the card.
00350           *
00351           * @param bAllReference If true all the invalid reference/pointer are destroyed.
00352           * @param bAllReference        PUT THIS PARAMETER TO TRUE IS THREAD UNSAFE.
00353           * @param bAllReference        You have to be sure that you will not use any old reference/pointer after this release
00354           */
00355         PTEIDSDK_API void releaseCard(bool bAllReference=false);
00356 
00357         /**
00358           * Return true if a card has changed since the last called (with the same ulOldId parameter).
00359           */
00360         PTEIDSDK_API bool isCardChanged(unsigned long &ulOldId);
00361 
00362         /**
00363          * Return the type of the card in the reader.
00364          *
00365          * Throw PTEID_ExNoCardPresent exception if no card is present.
00366          */
00367         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_CardType getCardType();
00368 
00369         /**
00370          * Get the card in the reader.
00371          *              Instantiation is made regarding the type of the card
00372          *                      (PTEID_EIDCard, PTEID_KidsCard, PTEID_ForeignerCard or PTEID_SISCard).
00373          *
00374          * If no card is present in the reader, exception PTEID_ExNoCardPresent is thrown.
00375          * If the card type is not supported, exception PTEID_ExCardTypeUnknown is thrown.
00376          */
00377     PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_Card &getCard();
00378 
00379         /**
00380          * Get the EIDcard in the reader.
00381          *              Instantiation is made regarding the type of the card
00382          *                      (PTEID_EIDCard, PTEID_KidsCard, PTEID_ForeignerCard).
00383          *
00384          * If no card is present in the reader, exception PTEID_ExNoCardPresent is thrown.
00385          * If the card is not an EIDcard, exception PTEID_ExCardBadType is thrown.
00386          */
00387     PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_EIDCard &getEIDCard();
00388 
00389         /**
00390          * Get the KidsCard in the reader.
00391          *
00392          * If no card is present in the reader, exception PTEID_ExNoCardPresent is thrown.
00393          * If the card is not a KidsCard, exception PTEID_ExCardBadType is thrown.
00394          */
00395         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_KidsCard &getKidsCard();
00396 
00397         /**
00398          * Get the ForeignerCard in the reader.
00399          *
00400          * If no card is present in the reader, exception PTEID_ExNoCardPresent is thrown
00401          * If the card is not a ForeignerCard, exception PTEID_ExCardBadType is thrown.
00402          */
00403         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_ForeignerCard &getForeignerCard();
00404 
00405         /**
00406          * Get the SISCard in the reader.
00407          *
00408          * If no card is present in the reader, exception PTEID_ExNoCardPresent is thrown.
00409          * If the card is not a SISCard, exception PTEID_ExCardBadType is thrown.
00410          */
00411         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_SISCard &getSISCard();
00412 
00413         /**
00414          * Specify a callback function to be called each time a
00415          * card is inserted/remove in/from this reader.
00416          *
00417          * @return A handle can be used to stop the callbacks when they are no longer needed.
00418          */
00419     PTEIDSDK_API unsigned long SetEventCallback(void (* callback)(long lRet, unsigned long ulState, void *pvRef), void *pvRef);
00420 
00421         /**
00422           * To tell that the callbacks are not longer needed.
00423           * @param ulHandle is the handle return by SetEventCallback
00424           */
00425         PTEIDSDK_API void StopEventCallback(unsigned long ulHandle);
00426 
00427         PTEIDSDK_API void BeginTransaction();                                                           /**< Begin a transaction with the reader */
00428         PTEIDSDK_API void EndTransaction();                                                             /**< End the transaction */
00429 
00430         PTEIDSDK_API bool isVirtualReader();                                                            /**< Return true if this is a virtual reader (create from a file) */
00431 
00432 private:
00433         PTEID_ReaderContext(const PTEID_ReaderContext& reader);                         /**< Copy not allowed - not implemented */
00434         PTEID_ReaderContext& operator= (const PTEID_ReaderContext& reader);     /**< Copy not allowed - not implemented */
00435 
00436         PTEID_ReaderContext(const SDK_Context *context,APL_ReaderContext *impl);                                                /**< For internal use : Constructor */
00437 
00438         unsigned long m_cardid;
00439         //CMutex *m_mutex;
00440 
00441 friend PTEID_ReaderContext &PTEID_ReaderSet::getReader(APL_ReaderContext *pAplReader); /**< For internal use : This method must access protected constructor */
00442 };

00447 /******************************************************************************//**
00448   * Abstract base class for all the card type supported.
00449   * The PTEID_ReaderContext::getCard() method will return such an object.
00450   *********************************************************************************/
00451 class PTEID_Card : public PTEID_Object
00452 {
00453 public:
00454         PTEIDSDK_API virtual ~PTEID_Card()=0;                           /**< Destructor */
00455 
00456         /**
00457          * Return the type of the card
00458          */
00459         PTEIDSDK_API virtual PTEID_CardType getType();
00460 
00461         /**
00462          * Return a document from the card.
00463          * Throw PTEID_ExDocTypeUnknown exception if the document doesn't exist for this card.
00464          */
00465         PTEIDSDK_API virtual PTEID_XMLDoc& getDocument(PTEID_DocumentType type)=0;
00466 
00467         /**
00468          * Return a raw data from the card.
00469          * Throw PTEID_ExFileTypeUnknown exception if the document doesn't exist for this card.
00470          */
00471         PTEIDSDK_API virtual const PTEID_ByteArray& getRawData(PTEID_RawDataType type)=0;
00472 
00473         /**
00474          * Send an APDU command to the card and get the result.
00475          * @param cmd is the apdu command
00476          * @return a PTEID_ByteArray containing the result
00477          */
00478     PTEIDSDK_API virtual PTEID_ByteArray sendAPDU(const PTEID_ByteArray& cmd);
00479 
00480         /**
00481          * Read a File from the card.
00482          * @param fileID is the path of the file
00483          * @param ulOffset is the offset to begins the reading
00484          * @param ulMaxLength is the maximum length of bytes to read
00485          * @return A PTEID_ByteArray with the content of the file
00486          */
00487         PTEIDSDK_API virtual PTEID_ByteArray readFile(const char *fileID, unsigned long  ulOffset=0, unsigned long  ulMaxLength=0);
00488 
00489         /**
00490          * Write a file to the card.
00491          * @param fileID is the path of the file
00492          * @param oData contents the bytes to write
00493          * @param ulOffset is the offset to begins the writing
00494          */
00495         PTEIDSDK_API virtual bool writeFile(const char *fileID, const PTEID_ByteArray& oData,unsigned long ulOffset=0);
00496 
00497 protected:
00498         PTEID_Card(const SDK_Context *context,APL_Card *impl);/**< For internal use : Constructor */
00499 
00500 private:
00501         PTEID_Card(const PTEID_Card& card);                                     /**< Copy not allowed - not implemented */
00502         PTEID_Card& operator= (const PTEID_Card& card);         /**< Copy not allowed - not implemented */
00503 
00504 };

00529 /******************************************************************************//**
00530   * Abstract base class for Smart card.
00531   *********************************************************************************/
00532 class PTEID_SmartCard : public PTEID_Card
00533 {
00534 public:
00535         PTEIDSDK_API virtual ~PTEID_SmartCard()=0;                              /**< Destructor */
00536 
00537         /**
00538          * Select an application from the card
00539          */
00540         PTEIDSDK_API void selectApplication(const PTEID_ByteArray &applicationId);
00541 
00542         /**
00543          * Send an APDU command to the card and get the result.
00544          * @param cmd is the apdu command
00545          * @param pin is the pin to ask for writing
00546          * @param csPinCode is the code of the pin (it will be asked if needed and not set)
00547          * @return a PTEID_ByteArray containing the result
00548          */
00549     PTEIDSDK_API virtual PTEID_ByteArray sendAPDU(const PTEID_ByteArray& cmd,PTEID_Pin *pin=NULL,const char *csPinCode="");
00550 
00551         /**
00552          * Read a File from the card.
00553          *
00554          * If no pin is passed and a pin is needed by the card, the pin code will be asked anyway.
00555          *
00556          * @param fileID is the path of the file
00557          * @param in return the file
00558          * @param pin is the pin to ask for reading
00559          * @param csPinCode is the code of the pin (it will be asked if needed and not set)
00560          */
00561         PTEIDSDK_API virtual long readFile(const char *fileID, PTEID_ByteArray &in,PTEID_Pin *pin=NULL,const char *csPinCode="");
00562 
00563         /**
00564          * Write a file to the card.
00565          * Throw PTEID_ExCmdNotAllowed exception you're not allowed to write the file.
00566          *
00567          * If no pin is passed and a pin is needed by the card, the pin code will be asked anyway.
00568          *
00569          * @param fileID is the path of the file
00570          * @param out contents the bytes to write
00571          * @param pin is the pin to ask for writing
00572          * @param csPinCode is the code of the pin (it will be asked if needed and not set)
00573          */
00574         PTEIDSDK_API virtual bool writeFile(const char *fileID,const PTEID_ByteArray &out,PTEID_Pin *pin=NULL,const char *csPinCode="");
00575 
00576         /**
00577          * Return the number of pin on the card.
00578          */
00579         PTEIDSDK_API virtual unsigned long pinCount();
00580 
00581         /**
00582          * Return an object to access all the pins on the card.
00583          */
00584         PTEIDSDK_API virtual PTEID_Pins& getPins();
00585 
00586         /**
00587          * Return the number of certificate on the card.
00588          */
00589         PTEIDSDK_API virtual unsigned long certificateCount();
00590 
00591         /**
00592          * Return an object to access all the certificates on the card.
00593          */
00594         PTEIDSDK_API virtual PTEID_Certificates& getCertificates();
00595 
00596         /**
00597           * Return the challenge.
00598           *
00599           * @param bForceNewInit force a new initialization of the couple challenge/response
00600           */
00601         PTEIDSDK_API virtual const PTEID_ByteArray &getChallenge(bool bForceNewInit = false);
00602 
00603         /**
00604           * Return the response to the challenge.
00605           */
00606         PTEIDSDK_API virtual const PTEID_ByteArray &getChallengeResponse();
00607 
00608         /**
00609           * Return true if the response of the card to the given challenge is the same as the response expected.
00610           * For virtual card (from file), always return false.
00611           *
00612           * @param challenge is the challenge to check
00613           * @param response is the response expected from the card
00614           */
00615         PTEIDSDK_API virtual bool verifyChallengeResponse(const PTEID_ByteArray &challenge, const PTEID_ByteArray &response) const;
00616 
00617 protected:
00618         PTEID_SmartCard(const SDK_Context *context,APL_Card *impl);     /**< For internal use : Constructor */
00619 
00620 private:
00621         PTEID_SmartCard(const PTEID_SmartCard& card);                                           /**< Copy not allowed - not implemented */
00622         PTEID_SmartCard& operator= (const PTEID_SmartCard& card);                       /**< Copy not allowed - not implemented */
00623 };
00624

00831           * Write the tlv document into the file csFilePath.

01112 class APL_Pin;
01113 
01114 /******************************************************************************//**
01115   * Class that represent one Pin.
01116   *********************************************************************************/
01117 class PTEID_Pin : public PTEID_Crypto
01118 {
01119 public:
01120         PTEIDSDK_API virtual ~PTEID_Pin();                              /**< Destructor */
01121 
01122         PTEIDSDK_API unsigned long getIndex();          /**< Get the index of the pin */
01123         PTEIDSDK_API unsigned long getType();                   /**< Get the type of the pin */
01124         PTEIDSDK_API unsigned long getId();                     /**< Get the id of the pin */
01125         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_PinUsage getUsageCode();     /**< Get the usage code of the pin */
01126         PTEIDSDK_API unsigned long getFlags();          /**< Get the flags of the pin */
01127         PTEIDSDK_API const char *getLabel();                    /**< Get the label of the pin */
01128 
01129         PTEIDSDK_API const PTEID_ByteArray &getSignature();     /**< Return the signature of the pin */
01130 
01131         /**
01132           * Return the remaining tries for giving the good pin.
01133           *
01134           * This opperation is not supported by all card.
01135           *
01136           * @return -1 if not supported
01137           * @return the number of remaining tries in the other case
01138           */
01139         PTEIDSDK_API long getTriesLeft();
01140 
01141         /**
01142           * Ask the card to verify the pin.
01143           * A popup will ask for the code.
01144           * @return true if success and false if failed
01145           */
01146         PTEIDSDK_API bool verifyPin();
01147 
01148         /**
01149           * Ask the card to verify the pin.
01150           *
01151           * @param csPin is the pin code to verify (if csPin is empty, a popup will ask for the code)
01152           * @param ulRemaining return the remaining tries (only if verifying failed)
01153           *
01154           * @return true if success and false if failed
01155           */
01156         PTEIDSDK_API bool verifyPin(const char *csPin,unsigned long &ulRemaining);
01157 
01158         /**
01159           * Ask the card to change the pin.
01160           * A popup will ask for the codes
01161           * @return true if success and false if failed
01162           */
01163         PTEIDSDK_API bool changePin();
01164 
01165         /**
01166           * Ask the card to change the pin.
01167           *
01168           * if csPin1 or csPin2 are empty, a popup will ask for the codes.
01169           *
01170           * @param csPin1 is the old pin code
01171           * @param csPin2 is the new pin code
01172           * @param ulRemaining return the remaining tries (only when operation failed)
01173           *
01174           * @return true if success and false if failed
01175           */
01176         PTEIDSDK_API bool changePin(const char *csPin1,const char *csPin2,unsigned long &ulRemaining);
01177 
01178 private:
01179         PTEID_Pin(const PTEID_Pin& pin);                                                                        /**< Copy not allowed - not implemented */
01180         PTEID_Pin& operator= (const PTEID_Pin& pin);                                            /**< Copy not allowed - not implemented */
01181 
01182         PTEID_Pin(const SDK_Context *context,APL_Pin *impl);                                            /**< For internal use : Constructor */
01183 
01184 friend PTEID_Pin &PTEID_Pins::getPinByNumber(unsigned long ulIndex);    /**< For internal use : This method must access protected constructor */
01185 };

01187 class APL_Crl;
01188 
01189 /******************************************************************************//**
01190   * Class that represents one CRL.
01191   *********************************************************************************/
01192 class PTEID_Crl : public PTEID_Object
01193 {
01194 public:
01195         /**
01196           * Create a Crl from its uri (without any certificate link).
01197           * As there is no issuer, this CRL can't be verify and some method are not allowed
01198           * (ex. getIssuer).
01199           * These methods throw PTEID_ExBadUsage exception.
01200           */
01201         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_Crl(const char *uri);
01202 
01203         PTEIDSDK_API virtual ~PTEID_Crl(void);                          /**< Destructor */
01204 
01205         PTEIDSDK_API const char *getUri();                              /**< Return the uri of the CRL */
01206 
01207         PTEIDSDK_API const char *getIssuerName();                       /**< Return the name of the issuer of the certificate */
01208 
01209         /**
01210           * Return the issuer certificate.
01211           *
01212           * if there is no issuer (root), PTEID_ExCertNoIssuer exception is thrown.
01213           */
01214         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_Certificate &getIssuer();
01215 
01216         /**
01217           * Return the CRL as a byte array.
01218           * If it comes from a Certif we verify the signature.
01219           * If it's created from the URL only we DON'T verify the signature.
01220           * @param crl will content the crl
01221           * @param bForceDownload : if true the CRL in the cache is not valid anymore and we force a new download
01222           */
01223         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_CrlStatus getData(PTEID_ByteArray &crl,bool bForceDownload=false);
01224 
01225         NOEXPORT_PTEIDSDK PTEID_Crl(const SDK_Context *context,APL_Crl *impl);  /**< For internal use : Constructor */
01226 
01227 private:
01228         PTEID_Crl(const PTEID_Crl& crl);                                /**< Copy not allowed - not implemented */
01229         PTEID_Crl &operator= (const PTEID_Crl& crl);    /**< Copy not allowed - not implemented */
01230 };
01231

01234 /******************************************************************************//**
01235   * Class that represents one OCSP Response.
01236   *********************************************************************************/
01237 class PTEID_OcspResponse : public PTEID_Object
01238 {
01239 public:
01240         /**
01241           * Create an OcspResponse object from the URI only and CertID.
01242           * This OCSP Response is not link to any certificate so some methods could not be used.
01243           * These methods throw PTEID_ExBadUsage exception.
01244           */
01245         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_OcspResponse(const char *uri,PTEID_HashAlgo hashAlgorithm,const PTEID_ByteArray &issuerNameHash,const PTEID_ByteArray &issuerKeyHash,const PTEID_ByteArray &serialNumber);
01246 
01247         PTEIDSDK_API virtual ~PTEID_OcspResponse(void);         /**< Destructor */
01248 
01249         PTEIDSDK_API const char *getUri();                                      /**< Return the uri of the responder */
01250 
01251         /**
01252           * Return the response.
01253           */
01254         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_CertifStatus getResponse(PTEID_ByteArray &response);
01255 
01256         NOEXPORT_PTEIDSDK PTEID_OcspResponse(const SDK_Context *context,APL_OcspResponse *impl);        /**< For internal use : Constructor */
01257 
01258 private:
01259         PTEID_OcspResponse(const PTEID_OcspResponse& ocsp);                             /**< Copy not allowed - not implemented */
01260         PTEID_OcspResponse &operator= (const PTEID_OcspResponse& ocsp); /**< Copy not allowed - not implemented */
01261 };

01263 class APL_Certifs;

01265 /******************************************************************************//**
01266   * Container class for all certificates on the card.
01267   *********************************************************************************/
01268 class PTEID_Certificates : public PTEID_Crypto
01269 {
01270 public:
01271         /**
01272           * Create an PTEID_Certificates store without any link to a card.
01273           * This store is not link to any Card, so some methods could not be used.
01274           * These methods throw PTEID_ExBadUsage exception.
01275           */
01276         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_Certificates();
01277 
01278         PTEIDSDK_API virtual ~PTEID_Certificates();                                     /**< Destructor */
01279 
01280         PTEIDSDK_API unsigned long countFromCard();                                     /**< The number of certificates on the card */
01281         PTEIDSDK_API unsigned long countAll();                                          /**< The number of certificates (on the card or not) */
01282 
01283         /**
01284           * Get the ulIndex certificate from the card.
01285           * Throw PTEID_ExParamRange exception if the index is out of range.
01286           */
01287         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_Certificate &getCertFromCard(unsigned long ulIndexCard);
01288 
01289         /**
01290           * Return the certificate with the number ulIndexAll.
01291           *
01292           * ATTENTION ulIndexAll and ulIndexCard are two different index.
01293           * Index will change if new certificates are added with addCert().
01294           */
01295         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_Certificate &getCert(unsigned long ulIndexAll);
01296 
01297         /**
01298           * Return the certificate by type.
01299           */
01300         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_Certificate &getCert(PTEID_CertifType type);
01301 
01302         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_Certificate &getRrn();                                               /**< Return the RRN certificate from the card */
01303         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_Certificate &getRoot();                                      /**< Return the root certificate from the card */
01304         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_Certificate &getCA();                                                /**< Return the ca certificate from the card */
01305         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_Certificate &getSignature();                         /**< Return the signature certificate from the card */
01306         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_Certificate &getAuthentication();                    /**< Return the authentication certificate from the card */
01307 
01308         /**
01309           * Add a new certificate to the store.
01310           */
01311         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_Certificate &addCertificate(PTEID_ByteArray &cert);
01312 
01313 
01314 private:
01315         PTEID_Certificates(const PTEID_Certificates& certifs);                  /**< Copy not allowed - not implemented */
01316         PTEID_Certificates& operator= (const PTEID_Certificates& certifs);/**< Copy not allowed - not implemented */
01317 
01318         PTEID_Certificates(const SDK_Context *context,APL_Certifs *impl);/**< For internal use : Constructor */
01319 
01320 friend PTEID_Certificates& PTEID_SmartCard::getCertificates();          /**< For internal use : This method must access protected constructor */
01321 };

01323 class APL_Certif;

01325 /******************************************************************************//**
01326   * Class that represent one certificate.
01327   *********************************************************************************/
01328 class PTEID_Certificate : public PTEID_Crypto
01329 {
01330 public:
01331         PTEIDSDK_API virtual ~PTEID_Certificate();                      /**< Destructor */
01332 
01333         PTEIDSDK_API const char *getLabel();                            /**< Return the label of the certificate */
01334         PTEIDSDK_API unsigned long getID();                             /**< Return the id of the certificate */
01335 
01336         /**
01337           * Return the status of the certificate using default validation level (from config).
01338           */
01339         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_CertifStatus getStatus();
01340 
01341         /**
01342           * Return the status of the certificate.
01343           */
01344         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_CertifStatus getStatus(PTEID_ValidationLevel crl, PTEID_ValidationLevel ocsp);
01345 
01346         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_CertifType getType();                        /**< Return the type of the certificate */
01347 
01348         PTEIDSDK_API const PTEID_ByteArray &getCertData();/**< Return the content of the certificate */
01349         PTEIDSDK_API void getFormattedData(PTEID_ByteArray &data);      /**< Return the content of the certificate without ending zero */
01350         PTEIDSDK_API const char *getSerialNumber();             /**< Return the serial number of the certificate */
01351         PTEIDSDK_API const char *getOwnerName();                        /**< Return the name of the owner of the certificate */
01352         PTEIDSDK_API const char *getIssuerName();                       /**< Return the name of the issuer of the certificate */
01353         PTEIDSDK_API const char *getValidityBegin();            /**< Return the validity begin date of the certificate */
01354         PTEIDSDK_API const char *getValidityEnd();              /**< Return the validity end date of the certificate */
01355         PTEIDSDK_API unsigned long getKeyLength();              /**< Return the length of public/private key on the certificate */
01356 
01357         /**
01358           * Return true if this is a root certificate.
01359           */
01360         PTEIDSDK_API bool isRoot();
01361 
01362         /**
01363           * Return the test status.
01364           *
01365           * @return true if test certificate
01366           * @return false if good one
01367           */
01368         PTEIDSDK_API bool isTest();
01369 
01370         /**
01371           * Return true if the certificate chain end by the one of pteid root.
01372           */
01373         PTEIDSDK_API bool isFromPTeidValidChain();
01374 
01375         /**
01376           * This certificate comes from the card.
01377           */
01378         PTEIDSDK_API bool isFromCard();
01379 
01380         /**
01381           * Return the issuer certificate.
01382           *
01383           * if there is no issuer (root), PTEID_ExCertNoIssuer exception is thrown
01384           */
01385         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_Certificate &getIssuer();
01386 
01387         /**
01388           * Return the number of children for this certificate.
01389           */
01390         PTEIDSDK_API unsigned long countChildren();
01391 
01392         /**
01393           * Return the children certificate (certificate that has been issued by this one).
01394           *
01395           * @param ulIndex is the children index (the index for the first child is 0)
01396           * Throw PTEID_ExParamRange exception if the index is out of range
01397           */
01398         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_Certificate &getChildren(unsigned long ulIndex);
01399 
01400         /**
01401           * Return the crl of the certificate.
01402           */
01403         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_Crl &getCRL();
01404 
01405         /**
01406           * Return the ocsp response object of the certificate.
01407           */
01408         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_OcspResponse &getOcspResponse();
01409 
01410 
01411         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_CertifStatus verifyCRL(bool forceDownload=false);            /**< Verify the certificate trough CRL validation */
01412         PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_CertifStatus verifyOCSP();                                                           /**< Verify the certificate trough OCSP validation */
01413 
01414 private:
01415         PTEID_Certificate(const PTEID_Certificate& certif);                             /**< Copy not allowed - not implemented */
01416         PTEID_Certificate& operator= (const PTEID_Certificate& certif); /**< Copy not allowed - not implemented */
01417 
01418         PTEID_Certificate(const SDK_Context *context,APL_Certif *impl); /**< For internal use : Constructor */
01419 
01420 friend PTEID_Certificate &PTEID_Certificates::getCert(unsigned long ulIndex);   /**< For internal use : This method must access protected constructor */
01421 friend PTEID_Certificate &PTEID_Certificates::getCertFromCard(unsigned long ulIndex);   /**< For internal use : This method must access protected constructor */
01422 friend PTEID_Certificate &PTEID_Certificates::getCert(PTEID_CertifType type);                   /**< For internal use : This method must access protected constructor */
01423 friend PTEID_Certificate &PTEID_Crl::getIssuer();                                                                               /**< For internal use : This method must access protected constructor */
01424 friend PTEID_Certificate &PTEID_Certificates::addCertificate(PTEID_ByteArray &cert);    /**< For internal use : This method must access protected constructor */
01425 };

01432 class PTEID_Config : public PTEID_Object

01437           */

01439

01441           * Create object to access a string parameter.
01442           */
01443     PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_Config(const char *csName, const char *czSection, const char *csDefaultValue);
01444 
01445         /**
01446           * Create object to access a numerical parameter.
01447           */
01448     PTEIDSDK_API PTEID_Config(const char *csName, const char *czSection, long lDefaultValue);
01449 
01450         PTEIDSDK_API virtual ~PTEID_Config();                   /**< Destructor */
01451 
01452     PTEIDSDK_API const char *getString();               /**< Return the string value (Throw exception for numerical parameter) */
01453     PTEIDSDK_API long getLong();                                        /**< Return the numerical value (Throw exception for string parameter) */
01454 
01455     PTEIDSDK_API void setString(const char *csValue);   /**< Set the string value (Throw exception for numerical parameter) */
01456         PTEIDSDK_API void setLong(long lValue);                         /**< Set the numerical value (Throw exception for string parameter) */
01457 
01458 private:
01459         PTEID_Config(const PTEID_Config& config);                               /**< Copy not allowed - not implemented */
01460         PTEID_Config& operator= (const PTEID_Config& config);   /**< Copy not allowed - not implemented */
01461 
01462         PTEID_Config(APL_Config *impl); /**< For internal use : Constructor */
01463 };
